intro: Aegopodium calycinum, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels, typically from June to August. The plant has fern-like, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and damp meadows. Aegopodium calycinum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
